intro: Euphrasia onegensis, commonly known as the Onegian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western Russia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are hairy and opposite, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Euphrasia onegensis is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
